704775f-a.title: Brooklyn: Hamilton Avenue - 14th Street
704775f-a.text:
Hamilton Avenue at 14th Street, Brooklyn. Neg. no. A-1349  P. L. Sperr, photographer
July 22, 190

704776f-a.title: Brooklyn: Hamilton Avenue - 14th Street
704776f-a.text:
Hamilton Avenue, north from 14th Str et, showing the bridge over the Gowanus Canal. On the right bank of the canal is the Devoe and Raynolds paint factory in the process of being torn down. This area was later rebuilt into the Gow nus Parkway, the borough's northerly extension of the Belt Parkway and the main highway leading to and from the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel.
October 17, 1940
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
NO RRPRODUCTIONS  Mew J. 82( 7o. 1P
/
View S NRag NeA AR1EE

702538f-a.text:
14th Street fr. Hamilton Avenue, Brooklyn. Neg. no. A-1348  P. L. Sperr, photographer

704774f-a.title: Brooklyn: Hamilton Avenue - 14th Street
704774f-a.text:
Hamilton Avenue, s. fr. 14th Street, Brooklyn. Neg. no. A-1350  P. L. Sperr, photographer
July 26, 190

704779f-a.title: Brooklyn: Hamilton Avenue - 14th Street
704779f-a.text:
Hamilton Avenue, east side, between 14th Street and the Gowanus Canal, showing the M. Schneider and Sons soap factory
after a fire destroyed the interior.
Views 2 and 3 show the same section of the avenue after the soap factory and other buildings were torn down and construction begun on the widening of the avenue as Brooklyn's northerly link in the Belt Parkway systam of highways.
P. L. Sperr  View 1: April 44, 1931
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 2,3: October 17, 1940
